headline.main: Is Russia the Sick Man of Eurasia?

docs.abstract: Dr Janette D Sherman letter links shortening of Russian lives and decline in live birth rates in recent years to Chernobyl nuclear accident in 1986 (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Your Dec. 3 front-page article about the shortening of Russian lives and decline in live births (''An Ailing Russia Lives a Tough Life That's Getting Shorter'') did not mention an important factor: the vast fallout of radioisotopes from the Chernobyl accident, which caused damage to cellular, immune and hormonal systems.
